jsx.ui.dd
Class Mouse

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.dd.Mouse
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnRender
Direct Known Subclasses:
Resizer
public class Mouse
extends Widget
implements OnRender

A base class for mouse widgets that wrap components to handle mouse operations.

A Mouse widget is a Widget that wraps a Component to provide additional mouse handling functionalities based on that component.

A Mouse widget is Configurable and is also an event source which fires mouse events and acts just like a mouse handle. Note that, the mouse events are fired from the mouse wrapper widget not the wrapped component so that the event listeners registered with the wrapped component may also handle them.

Meanwhile, it is interesting that a Mouse widget is also an event listener that handles Render event fired from the wrapped component, which means an extended class of this one can do more things in an event handler method that overrides the handler method of this class, such as onEvent(Render), but calling the overridden method would be the first thing for the overriding one to do not to lose the mouse handling of this class.

This class fires DragMove events by its local event dispatcher other than the general one.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Constructor Detail

Mouse

protected Mouse(Component e)

A typical constructor forcing constructors of subclasses to pass a component.

This constructor tries to initialize the newly constructed mouse widget. If the wrapped component is not rendered, it adds this event listener to the component to handle Render event and makes the event handling method onEvent(Render) do the initialization.

Parameters:
e - The underlying component.
Since:
1.0
Method Detail

onEvent

public void onEvent(Render evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method initializes the mouse wrapper widget.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnRender
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0

getMouse

public static final Mouse getMouse(Component e)

Gets the mouse widget for a component.

The method simply returns the mouse widget that wraps the specified component if there is one. Otherwise, it creates one to wrap the component and returns the newly created widget.

Parameters:
e - An component to handle mouse operations.
Returns:
A mouse widget that wraps the specified component.
Since:
1.0

getDelay

public static final int getDelay(Mouse h)

Gets the delay of a mouse in milliseconds.

This method returns a number value that specifies the milliseconds the mouse needs to wait before firing a MouseOver event and a DragStart event for dragging mode when it has been pressed.

Parameters:
h - The current mouse wrapper.
Returns:
The milliseconds to wait before firing a MouseOver or DragStart event.
Since:
1.0

setDelay

public static final void setDelay(Mouse h,
                                  int delay)

Sets the delay of a mouse in milliseconds.

This method sets the number of milliseconds that the mouse needs to wait before firing a MouseOver event and a DragStart event for dragging mode when it has been pressed.

This method may resets the mouse wrapper and should not be called in an event handler method that is handling mouse events fired from this mouse.

Parameters:
h - The current mouse wrapper.
delay - The milliseconds to wait before firing a MouseOver or DragStart events.
Since:
1.0

delay

public static final void delay(Mouse h,
                               int delay)

Sets the delay of a mouse in milliseconds.

This method sets the number of milliseconds that the mouse needs to wait before firing a DragStart event when it has been pressed.

This method may resets the mouse wrapper and should not be called in an event handler method that is handling mouse events fired from this mouse.

Parameters:
h - The current mouse wrapper.
delay - The milliseconds to wait before firing a DragStart event.
Since:
1.0

destroy

public static final void destroy(Mouse h)

Destroys the specified mouse.

It detaches the current mouse wrapper from its underlying component but not that the component is to destroy.

A destroyed mouse will not fire any events but you can get it back with a call to the method getMouse(Component) with the same component.

This method may resets the mouse wrapper and should not be called in an event handler method that is handling mouse events fired from this mouse.

Parameters:
h - The current mouse wrapper.
Since:
1.0
